subject: Travel
title: Chinese New Year Traditions
description: A 60-second lesson on Chinese New Year Traditions.

hook.text: Chinese New Year triggers the largest human migration on Earth. Three billion trips are made in six weeks.

buildup.text: Families clean their homes top to bottom before the holiday to sweep away bad luck.

discovery.text: Red decorations hang everywhere because a monster called Nian was said to fear the color red.

twist.text: Firecrackers were invented to scare Nian away. The tradition stuck even after the legend faded.

climax.text: Red envelopes filled with money are given to children. The cash amount must avoid the number four.

punchline.text: An ancient monster created the world's biggest party.

quiz.question: Why is the color red so important during Chinese New Year?
options: A legendary monster was said to fear red
